body: Portrait and landscape painter Malcolm Parcell was born in Claysville, near Washington, PA. In 1902 the Parcell family moved to Prosperity, near Washington, Pennsylvania, where one of his childhood haunts was an old cabin hidden in the woods near his home. His older brother, Evans, was to become a well-known illustrator and whose illustrations appeared in many of the popular magazines of the time.  Parcell took art instruction at the Carnegie Institute of Technology (now Carnegie-Mellon University) from 1913 to 1917.
